question: The second pharyngeal pouch gives rise to which of the following?

A 63-year-old man fails to maintain balance during linear motion. Which of the following sensory organs is responsible for detecting linear acceleration?

An 8-year-old boy is brought to the outpatient department with complaints of nasal blockage and impairment of hearing. On examination, a diagnosis of adenoiditis is made due to inflammation of the tonsils. Where is the appropriate group of tonsils present?

A clinician examines the extrinsic musculature of the eyes of a 50-year-old female patient. All extraocular muscles are functioning fine except one. Which of the following muscles is affected based on the action mentioned?
Which of the following is a feature of complete anterior cleft anomaly?

answers.option: Cleft extends through upper lip and alveolar part of maxilla to the incisive fossa
Cleft extends through lips and alveolar part of maxilla to the incisive fossa on both sides
Cleft extends through lips and alveolar part of maxilla
Cleft extends through maxilla and hard palate
Cleft extends through lip, maxilla, soft palate, and hard palate

answers.option: It consists of stratified columnar epithelium
It strongly adheres to Bruch's membrane of choroid

It contains stores of vitamin A

question: Which of the following statement is incorrect about the retina of the eye?

answers.option: A shallow depression called fovea is present in its posterior wall containing only cones
It is the innermost layer of eye and is responsible for photoreception
It is easily detached from underlying choroid
It terminates anteriorly at orra serrata

answers.option: Vocal cords approximated and larynx is pulled upwards

question: Extraocular muscles are supplied by nerves that pass through which of the following?

question: A colorblind person, who is a protanope, lacks which of the following?

question: The olfactory epithelium is located at which site in the nasal cavity?

question: Which of the following regarding mucous membrane of the tongue is incorrect?
